title.native: シュタインズ・ゲート ゼロ

description:
The eccentric, self-proclaimed mad scientist Rintarou Okabe has become a shell of his former self. Depressed and traumatized after failing to rescue his friend, he has decided to forsake his mad scientist alter ego and live as an ordinary college student. Surrounded by friends who know little of his time travel experiences, Okabe spends his days trying to forget the horrors of his adventures alone.

While working as a receptionist at a college technology forum, Okabe meets the short, spunky Maho Hiyajo, who later turns out to be the interpreter at the forum's presentation, conducted by Professor Alexis Leskinen. In front of a stunned crowd, Alexis and Maho unveil Amadeus—a revolutionary AI capable of storing a person's memories and creating a perfect simulation of that person complete with their personality and quirks. Meeting with Maho and Alexis after the presentation, Okabe learns that the two were Kurisu's colleagues in university, and that they have simulated her in Amadeus. Hired by Alexis to research the simulation's behavior, Okabe is given the chance to interact with the shadow of a long-lost dear friend. Dangerously tangled in the past, Okabe must face the harsh reality and carefully maneuver around the disastrous consequences that come with disturbing the natural flow of time.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

name.native: アレクシス・レスキネン

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

Zwei is a Japanese duo formed in 2003 composed of model Megumi Ueno (born May 24, 1980) on bass and Ayumu (born March 30, 1978) on vocals.
They are known for their SciADV songs (Robotics;Notes, Steins;Gate 0; Occultic;Nine).
They announces their break up on May 26, 2024.

Website | Wiki | YouTube MAGES. is a Japanese video game manufacturer and record label for video game and anime music. 5pb. Inc. was formed on April 6, 2005 after Chiyomaru Shikura left Scitron to begin the company as its executive director, the position he still holds. The company is divided into two parts, MAGES. GAME for the manufacturing of video games, and MAGES. MUSIC for the record label. 5pb. was a wholly owned subsidiary of the TYO Group until Shikura purchased the remaining rights from the TYO Group on April 15, 2009. Shikura co-owned 5pb. with AGOne, an affiliate of Dwango Japan. 5pb. Inc. changed their name to MAGES. Inc. in 2011. In 2019 Chiyomaru Studio bought off MAGES. from Dwango Japan and merged 5pb. Games and 5pb. Records with MAGES.. In 2020 the company was bought by Colopl.

__[Blog](http://huke.blog.shinobi.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hukeweb) | [DeviantArt](https://www.deviantart.com/ryoheihuke) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=9794) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ryoheihuke/)__

huke is a Japanese illustrator who is best known for creating the original character [Black★Rock Shooter](https://anilist.co/character/19706) and working with the Japanese music group [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913). His career as a professional illustrator began when he was involved as a character designer at a game company. He eventually resigned and became freelance, creating original concepts from his experience as a professional. huke soon became involved in certain illustrations based on the game Metal Gear Solid, and to enable and identify himself over the internet, he registered on Pixiv and created a personal blog. On December 2007, he submitted an illustration of Black★Rock Shooter. This inspired [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941), the leader of supercell, and a song became the product of the band's first contact with Black★Rock Shooter. Aside from Black★Rock Shooter, huke also worked on the visual novel Steins;Gate, which was produced by [5pb.](https://anilist.co/staff/109749) and [Nitroplus](https://anilist.co/staff/99960). He also designed Hololive EN 1st Gen VTuber, [Takanashi Kiara](https://anilist.co/staff/206030/Kiara-Takanashi).

[Website](http://5pb.jp/records/sp/asami/index.html) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/ubiquitous777/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/asamingosu)

Debuted as a voice actress in 1999 and as singer in 2009 by releasing her first single "Day by Day / Shining Blue Rain" under the 5pb. Records label. Currently working with Eri Kitamura in the music unit ARTERY VEIN.

**Non-Anime Roles:**

- Drake - Azur Lane (VG)
- Levia - Trillion: God of Destruction (VG)
- Noire / Black Heart - Hyperdimension Neptunia
- Otohana Sumire - Blue Archive

[Official Website](http://valsound.fc2web.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/valsound)

Takeshi Abo is a Japanese video game composer. He was employed by KID beginning in 1990, and joined 5pb. in December 2006 after KID declared bankruptcy. He is known for composing the music for popular visual novels such as Ever17 -the out of infinity-, ChäoS;HEAd, and Steins;Gate.

__[Website](https://erisasaki.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eri_lattice)__

__Eri Sasaki__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer, who is signed to 5pb. Records and Sony Music Publishing. She made her music debut in 2015 with the release of her first single "Ring of Fortune", which is used as the opening theme to the anime television series Plastic Memories. She released her first album in 2017.

(Source: [Eri Sasaki's Official Website](https://erisasaki.net/profile), edited)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chiyomaru5pb)__ | __[Company Profile (MAGES)](http://mages.co.jp/about/company/)__

__Chiyomaru Shikura__ is a Japanese guitarist, novelist, voice actor, radio personality, moderator, animation planner, animation supervisor, music producer, composer, arranger and the representative director of 5pb./MAGES. 

Chiyomaru resigns as chairman and representative director of MAGES. on January 4th, 2023.

He has been the producer and lead animation planner for titles such as Chaos;Head, Steins;Gate, and Robotics;Notes. Shikura is also a very active composer and lyricist. To date, he has written over a hundred theme songs for the video games and anime adaptations he's worked on.
